Hi, I'm an Australian software engineer that's really interested in how technology can be used to help a large amount of people agree on complex issues. I've been reading about vTaiwan and http://pol.is and was wondering if there's any room for an English only speaker to get involved/help out?
jfilmer: No specific channel for english only I think but maybe try <#C084CU74J|intl> or just here :slightly_smiling_face:
Ah, sorry didn't realise there were channels other than general :smile: cheers!
but most of us use <#C02G2SXKX|general> normally.
hi @undefined welcome , g0v community & http://ocf.tw have an English news site, maybe you can share these articles with your friend https://g0v.news/tagged/en
If you are interested in developing software, most codes were here: https://github.com/g0v
If you are interested in face-to-face gathering, There is a conference on Spetember 11th-13th https://ocftw.kktix.cc/events/civictechfest2017
( Call for Talks open: April 16th-June 16th , Travel Grant Application open: April 15th - June 16th )
Was working on translating resources and generally trying to gather understandings for transferring location contexts: http://beta.hackfoldr.org/vkanata
Also, @theobass at NestaUK is working on a longer english-language case study on vTaiwan, which will hopefully be out in a few weeks :)
